title: title

text:
-updates sklearn.cross_validation to sklearn.model_selection: cross_val_score() now takes a groups argument before scoring.
-adds group label argument (default None) for cross validation schemes accepting labels such as LeaveOneGroupOut(). This might be useful for those interested in leaving one run out at a time in their cross-validation schemes. 

example: 
cv = model_selection.LeaveOneGroupOut()
sl = decoding.Searchlight(cv=cv)
sl.fit(imgs, y, groups)
title: [MRG] add group information to Searchlight

title: Pull request merge from njchiang/nilearn:searchlight-group-compatibility to nilearn/nilearn:master

text:
Sounds good, thanks !
One thing that is missing now is some units tests to check that the groups variable is used correctly.
LGTM overall. Thx.

>I should note that by using model_selection, the cross_validation will no longer be compatible with scikit-learn < 0.15 (I think that is when model_selection was introduced)

You can have a look at ```nilearn/_utils/fixes/__init__.py```.

Thanks @njchiang. Overall your PR looks good. I will have a closer look in mean time.

Minor comment: Could you address flake8 errors. Basically there are too long line written
https://travis-ci.org/nilearn/nilearn/jobs/258020225
Apart from my small comment. I am +1 to merge.
Merged. Thank you for your work.

text:
add group information

-updates sklearn.cross_validation to sklearn.model_selection
-adds group label argument for cross validation schemes accepting labels
such as LeaveOneGroupOut()

increase compatibility and add tests

added sklearn 0.15 compatibility in searchlight.py by moving "groups"
into kwargs

added basic tests to test_searchlight.py (correct usage and superfluous
usage). the results should be identical to the tests above it.

fixing cross validation compatibility issues

-added version check to cross_val_score import in _utils.fixes
-searchlight imports cross_val_score from _utils.fixes

update scikit learn check for groups

updated cutoff for groups to 0.18

edit test case

an import statement in test cases was causing tests on incompatible
versions to fail
editing comments and formatting
remove unnecessary import
Merge remote-tracking branch 'refs/remotes/nilearn/master' into searchlight-group-compatibility
Merge remote-tracking branch 'refs/remotes/nilearn/master' into searchlight-group-compatibility

update documentation

updated "group membership" to "group labels" and made a note that groups
function won't have any effect in sklearn < 0.18
update searchlight group label documentation

title: Pull request merge from mjboos/nilearn:matrix-plotting-function to nilearn/nilearn:master

text:
> W.r.t. the tests @bthirion should I just add a function to nilearn/plotting/
> tests/test_display.py?

Yes
@mjboos : this is almost done. Any chances that you finish this PR?

> @GaelVaroquaux yes. sorry for the hiatus. Will finish it later.

Great! I am absolutely looking forward.
This is great! Thank you so much, @mjboos ! Merging.

@mjboos : I did a few modifications to this PR directly in master: https://github.com/nilearn/nilearn/commit/5830eee2522cc9c00056f876e0e3a8debd184e7c

I am quite happy that we have been able to simplify the examples quite significantly.

> There are few examples left to update. For example, in decoding I think. Shall I go through over them ?

You can have a look. I am pretty much offline as of now :)

Hi all, 
I changed the pep8 issues and grid behavior, should work now. @KamalakerDadi I can not replicate the grid-lines without specifying grid=True behavior. The default imshow-cmap looked fine in the examples.

W.r.t. the tests @bthirion should I just add a function to nilearn/plotting/tests/test_display.py?
@GaelVaroquaux yes. sorry for the hiatus. Will finish it later.

@mjboos I made a start quite a while ago. Particularly, if your interested in some inputs validations or some other things. You can have a look at [this link](https://gist.github.com/KamalakerDadi/34abed6fe088908b79e79c5ef6641d75)

Hi @mjboos. I understand that it is WIP but I was using your PR to plot matrices and thought that it may be useful to let you know some quirks. With @GaelVaroquaux 

* By default, colormap is very low without specifying any explicit colormap. May be we need bright default choice.

* By default, grid is False. But, I see plots with grid.
![matrix_plot](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11410385/24111245/20df89b2-0d96-11e7-8c09-1292a45fda87.png)

* Explicitly specifying as grid=True 
```
ValueError: to_rgba: Invalid rgb arg "True"
cannot convert argument to rgb sequence.
```

title: title

text:
In https://github.com/mne-tools/mne-python/pull/4408, we noticed that the plotting of the glass brain can be counter intuitive:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4881164/28624736-1470c64e-71e8-11e7-9554-13d39d18588a.png)

Specifically, the above drawing shows the temporal lobes and the cortex hides the cerebellum. The drawing thus suggests a front view. However, the left right lateralization suggests a back view (the left hemisphere is on the left if we look at the brain from the back).

It would be great to change the drawing depending on the mirror. Specifically, I was thinking of something like this for the backview:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4881164/28624389-0253ba76-71e7-11e7-9cb9-08fe585965ad.png)
title: glass brain: front versus back view
glass brain: front versus back view

text:
Thanks. Regarding the PR, I can make the drawing if you indicate me
1) where to look for the data used to draw the first 3 plots, and 
2) which sulci to draw.
text
title: title

text:
For plotting a few brains (or views of brains), it would be cool if `plot_surf_stat_map` exposed an axes parameter (so that you can do e.g. `for ax, data_ in zip(axes, data): plot_surf_stat_map(..., ax=ax)` and get multiple brains in one figure.

If this sounds like a good idea, and not yet implemented in a different function, I'd be willing to make a PR.
title: axes parameter for plot_surf?

text: Ok, I'll try to get on it next week.
Closing with PR #1462

text
title: title

text:
closes https://github.com/nilearn/nilearn/issues/1485.

* The cortical outskirt is identical to the front view
* I changed the sulci and cerebellum using combination of  'nilearn/plotting/glass_brain_files/plot_align.svg' and the [following 3D rendering](https://www.nature.com/articles/srep43293?ncid=txtlnkusaolp00000618)
* I ran the json converter locally
* I changed the default 'y' direction to use the back view. 

Here is how it looks:
![back2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4881164/28628591-09a90dc4-71f3-11e7-90bf-1d339da1c7d0.png)
![back](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4881164/28628573-fdc7a0a6-71f2-11e7-8b7e-25c7eab3132e.png)
![back3](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4881164/28628589-080e440c-71f3-11e7-8eec-fbd4a1bee0b3.png)

A subsequent PR could be made to have the option of using a mirror view which would make use of the front view, but this would require additional plotting parameters, and a bottom view.

text:
closes https://github.com/nilearn/nilearn/issues/1485.

* The cortical outskirt is identical to the front view
* I changed the sulci and cerebellum using combination of  'nilearn/plotting/glass_brain_files/plot_align.svg' and the [following 3D rendering](https://www.nature.com/articles/srep43293?ncid=txtlnkusaolp00000618)
* I ran the json converter locally
* I changed the default 'y' direction to use the back view.

A subsequent PR could be made to have the option of using a mirror view which would make use of the front view, but this would require additional plotting parameters, and a bottom view.

title: Pull request merge from kingjr/nilearn:glass_back to nilearn/nilearn:master

text:
Thx. I see 2 things in this PR:
* A fix of the inconsistency between brain anatomical projection and 'L' and 'R' tags
* A change of the default 'y' view fom front to back
While the first point is to be accepted, I am quite unsure about the second: this alters default behavior of the plotting routine. What do people think ?
+1. Thx again !
